author: phoinix
title: amazing
review:
no review for this amazing set yet?
well i just got it today and i must say i am impressed!
great detail with just a few pieces
amazing building technics
love the yellow color
smooth design

a great set

author: vhtf_hw_lego
title: Summaries For Cool Cars
review:
Year Introduced: 2007. 
Elements: ±206 Pieces. 
Minifig: None. 
Retail price was USD 10.00.

Likes
1st: +++++ 3 creations available. European Car, haulier & F1 Racers. 
2nd: +++ Lots of building fun. It is good for teaching young Lego collectors.
3rd: Pricing. +++ We bought this set at SGD 19.90 (USD 13.26). 

Dislikes: 
1st: --- Yellow. It will be better in Red or Blue especially for the 1st (Car) & 3th (F1 Racer) configuration.

We have 1 too!
Visit us at ebay.com.sg
Thanks & B.Rgds
Eugene Tan

author: Beren
title: Lots of good basic parts
review:
I don't especially like any of the models that you can make using the instructions. The great thing about this set is the amount of parts that you get, especially good, basic parts like plates, windows, wheels and so on. As a result, this is an excellent set for a young person starting out on their Lego adventures. Also, unlike some other reviewers, I really like the colour. I wouldn't have bought it if it was blue.

In summary, a good set for people who want to create their own models and designs.

author: bmwlego
title: Cheese Wedges Galore!
review: This is an awesome set that comes with many cheese wedge slope pieces (Slope Brick 33 1 x 1 x 2/3). There are many yellow and clear pieces of this particular piece and for 10 bucks, you can't go wrong if you like this piece. I have built 2 of the three main models and was happy with both end results.

author: adik_sa_lego
title: finally!
review:
finally found this set in our local supermarket, the least likely place i would've gotten it.

i stuck with the original instructions since i have a lot of trucks and F1 cars already, and i must say, it could pass off as a lamborghini licensed set. interior was detailed (manual transmission lever, airconditioning), roomy trunk (i fit all the extra pieces in it), fun and challenging construction without being frustrating.

an engine detail would've been a nice touch at the rear compartment, but overall i have no qualms about this set. it's also about time one got a "neutral" car for his/her town or city.

author: AA01
title: Great Kit!
review:
I saw this kit sitting on the shelf and debated weather or not to pick it up. After building one of the models, I do not regret the purchase. Bang-for-buck this is one of the best Lego kits i have bought.

The good: There are many pieces to this kit. It makes a Great desk toy. The kit is not overly complex, but is intricate enough to have things like the doors and trunk open.

The bad: The only thing i can really say i was disappointed with is that the shot on the front shows the wheels turned, and this model does not have any steering. Other than that, I don't have any complaints

The main model is the best in this kit in my opinion. It looks very detailed for the small number of pieces and overall size.

author: Paradosis
title: A Bit Lackluster
review: Cool Cars is not as good as some other creator sets, though it's still a fairly good set. One issue I have with the set is the color: I'm sure yellow probably appeals to the kids, but I'd personally prefer a different color. After all, how many bright yellow rigs are there out there? But that's not a huge issue, and the two car models look fine in yellow. The models aren't blocky for the most part; the rig comes closest to being blocky, which is ironic because the rig is my favorite of the three models in this set. There are details on the vehicles here and there, such as working doors and a trunk, but not as many details as you see in other creator sets. Also, while the door design on main model is good overall, it doesn't leave much space for windows to see out of. This is a good set to get if you want lots of yellow (with black and dark grey accents, and a number of clear parts), but it's not a must have like a number of the other creator sets are. I'd give the set a 70/100.

author: smiley905
title: good

author: Xenon
title: Vroom Vroom!
review:
This set is a 3 in 1 set which builds a sports car, a semi truck and a race car. The sports car is the best one out of the models in exterior and interior details. It also features opening doors and trunk. The semi is okay but mediocre and features opening doors. The race car is just a yellow race car with no features.

sports car
PROS
yellow
opening gullwing doors
trunk for storage
good detail
CONS
cannot fit minifig in there(but you could always pop the roof of and make a few modifications with the wall elements)

semi truck
PROS
can fit minifig inside
can hook up to a trailer
CONS
none

race car
PROS
good for display
CONS
its the most boring 1

author: lego12
title: This set is actually cool...
review:
This Creator set has a nice color and you can build it into three other models (Semi, race car, and a sports car). The doors can open and close. The trunk of the sports car can open  and you can put things inside of it. The semi's doors can also open. This set is cheap considering the fact it is $12.99. It is a fun set and it contains 206 pieces.
  Lego12

author: uberpuma1
title: Deceptive box??
review:
Ok, I knew better... but on the box, the wheels are turned.  Anyone else notice that?

It was a great set on clearance for the yellow parts.. Ive never built the set, but it doesnt really look like it actually has a steering mechanism. 

Cars would be small when built as they are only about 8 wide. Good for kids.

If I could get more of these for the price I paid on clearance, I would definately do it just for the yellow plates and slopes.

pro's
pieces
small flexible design
color

con's 
steering

author: Lambman
title: Nice Cars
review:
This is a great set. I got it when I was looking for a clone troopers battlepack but I got my hands on one of these babys instead. It is full of great building possibilities! I made the main models, but then I made an almost to Minifig scale Corvette and Its awsome! I love putting my sig-fig behind the wheel. Anyway, the main models are a slick sportscar, a nice racecar, and a big truck. My fav is definitely the sports car. Oh ya, also, it has a great price! 206 pieces for 12 bucks!

Bye!
Shane

author: stevosowl
title: A nice creator car
review:
The second creator car in my collection, have made two of the models so far.

Model 1 - sportscar - this is the star of the 3 models, a nice bright yellow "Lambo" style car. 8 pegs wide and 18 long it is a good overall size.

pros:
'lambo' doors
opening boot/ engine compartment
nice style

cons:
will not fit minifig

Model 2- tractor - this was the first model i made with this set. it was an easy build and the overall effect is quite detailed - remarkable as it uses the bits from the lambo sportscar.

pros:
very detailed
a good looking model

cons:
much smaller than the car
does not fit minifig
no steering wheel in cab
a flimsy construction on the cab

author: nivracer
title: very good creator set
review: I forgot where I got this set. but this set is awosom! it was $12.99 US. This car can work for city, but the minifig has to lay down in the car. I realy liked how LEGO put gull wing doors and an openinng trunk. I have never built the truck even Ihave had this for a few years. I lost some peces but I found them not to long ago. I can tell you about the race car. I built that a long time ago

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Creator - Cool Cars Review
review:
This set is the biggest set of the LEGO Creator theme I've got. You can build 3 different models but you can't build all of them at once. This set may doesn't have so many play features but it's very easy to maneuver these vehicles around. All of these 3 models are very easy to build and fun to play with. We also don't get any stickers to worry about. I've also tried to put in a minifigs in these cars but there's no room for them in there. The other 2 models you can build with this set are a truck and an IndyCar. It's a great set to have for sure.

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Review

author: fatalleader
title: New cop in town
review: I actually bought this for a custom Lego cop I have. After a few mods, it was ready. I removed a few unnecessary pieces and added lights. Granted, I have to position the steering wheel weird and have to remove a few arms for his wife to ride in it too, but it's worth it. Much better than my rocket-powered Police Cruiser idea. I did that by using parts from an old Lego Towns/space rocket and the original A-wing, plus my own collection.

author: PicnicBasketSam
title: The set name underestimates the sheer coolness of this thing.
review:
Today I'm reviewing one of my first LEGO sets, the Creator Cool Cars. Mostly I'm working from memory and this little pic of the box, so bear with me if I pull out the rose-colored lenses for a bit...

Box/Instructions
I seem to remember the box being today's standard $15 size. The instructions have also been lost to time, but they were divided into one book for the main model and one for the alternates. Typical Creator style, of course, I didn't know that at the age of four.

 

Parts
When I got this, I was in awe at the parts selection. That lovely old dark red, and the Technic wheels, clip hinges, cheese slopes, and curves were all new to me. Before, I was just working with my dad's old collection.

 

Minifigures
2007 is before the advent of minifigs in Creator sets. Of course, they wouldn't be here today anyway. Moving on...

 

The build
It does what it's supposed to do. At the same time basic and refreshing, I had a blast building it. Taking it apart to build alternate models, though, was an entirely different matter.

 

The completed model
It's a very cool car. The doors and trunk open revealing a full interior and space for grocery bags, it's filled to the brim with good parts for a little kid like me moving into a world of LEGO seven and a half years ago, and it has some brilliant alternate models.

 

Overall opinion
As a four and a half year old kid, I loved this set. I rebuilt it recently, and believe me, it doesn't disappoint. If you like this sort of set, you could probably eBay it for very little money. Very much reccomended!
